main event: A bright light was observed in the sky over Bethlehem, Pennsylvania on January 8, 1967.
interesting points: The light was estimated to be about 10 feet in diameter and was observed for approximately 30 minutes before disappearing.
The witness, whose name is redacted, reported observing the bright light in the sky.
The report includes handwritten descriptions and some photographs, but no actual UFO sighting.
The report mentions a request for the witness to complete an AF Form 164 to provide more details about the sighting.
The report also mentions that it would be impossible for the witness to have seen Jupiter, Mars, and Venus at the same time on the night of January 17, 1967.
sighted object: a bright light in the sky
photographs: yes, the report includes some photographs, but no UFO sighting
